clinical_study.brief_title: Paravertebral Block (PVB) Combined Pectoral Musculature Blocks for Modified Radical Mastectomy (MRM)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparisons the Analgesia of Paravertebral Block Combined With Thoracic Wall Block Versus Paravertebral Block Alone for Modified Radical Mastectomy in Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Previous studies have shown that PVB reduces pain and postoperative nausea and vomiting after breast cancer surgery when used in addition to general anesthesia or sedation. However, major breast cancer surgery involves areas beyond the breast tissue, such as pectoral musculature.

primary_outcome.description: target controlled infusion (TCI) propofol driven by the Schnider model in effect site control titrated to reach conscious sedation defined as Observer Assessment of Alertness/Sedation score of 2 to 3

secondary_outcome.measure: time to first request of analgesics

secondary_outcome.time_frame: postoperation to within 24 hours after discharge

arm_group.description: receiving paravertebral block and blocks targeting pectoral musculature

study_pop.textblock: Eligible patients were that diagnosed to have unilateral breast cancer and undergone modified radical mastectomy using regional anesthesia during Jun 1, 2012 and May 31, 2015.
